agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging providing programs and services that benefit low income, disadvantaged, and older persons living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash Counties.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES - MIAMI COUNTY
service_name: SENIOR FARMERS MARKET NUTRITION PROGRAM - MIAMI COUNTY
service_description: Offers Farmers Market electronic dollars to eligible seniors at no cost to use at participating farmers markets for fresh fruits and vegetables. Each participant receives $50 in electronic funds that must be used within 30 days of distribution. There are limited slots available with a waitlist following distribution, awaiting funds becoming available after 30 days due to non-use.
site_details: Participants must complete a new application each fiscal year. -- Call to schedule an appointment or for available dates and times; (A list of participating markets is available on the market app, electronically only.) -- Participant may designate a proxy to apply for certification and purchase of produce.
site_eligibility: Living in the county where eligibility is being determined -- Age 60 or older -OR- Age 55 or older, person with disabilities that is living in housing for elderly and participating in a congregate nutrition service -- Household income at or below 185% federal poverty guidelines, utilizing a confirmed agency service

agency_desc: A church with worship services with charitable outreach, including food pantry.
service_description: Provides a monthly food distribution that is open to all.
site_details: Walk in or drive up.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES - SENIOR NUTRITION PROGRAM
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Five), providing services to seniors in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County.
site_name: AREA FIVE CONGREGATE MEALS - MIAMI SENIOR CENTER
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship for area seniors. Reservations required at least 24 hours in advance. A donation is requested.
site_details: Call at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older

agency_desc: Provides community health services throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers primary health care, and school/sports/employment exams, disease management, laboratory testing, and immunizations to patients of all ages.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for services or financial needs assessment. (if applicable)
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 8am-6pm; Tues and Wed 8am-4:30pm; Fri 8am-3pm
Mon and Thurs 8am-6pm; Tues and Wed 8am-4:30pm; Fri 8am-3pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church that offers a bereavement support group to help those recovering from the loss of a loved one.
service_description: Offers a support group for those experiencing the loss of a loved one.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
nameLevel5: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Support Group: Monthly 2nd Sun 2pm-3pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Provides pregnancy counseling and support from a pro-life perspective, and offers referrals to prenatal care, adoption resources, and other abortion alternatives.

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Miami County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Miami County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Conducts local health fairs, provides health education services to the public, and maintains the lending library and other information resources for the County.
site_details: Call for information about arranging a group presentation.
site_eligibility: Schools, community organizations, and other groups

agency_desc: A nonprofit providing various community outreach programs and resource connections throughout Miami County.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and meat to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in; first come, first serve. New clients need to arrive before 11:30am.
site_eligibility: With household income at or below 185% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Not received food from this pantry within the past 14 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering a food pantry to persons in need.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Miami County

agency_desc: Provides electric service to customers in Cass and Miami counties and portions of Howard County within the city of Kokomo.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in Cass and Miami County and portions of Howard County.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Cass, Miami, and Howard counties

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental units in Miami County to seniors, and persons with disabilities. Pre-applications to be placed on the wait list are currently being accepted. No emergency housing is available.
site_details: Walk in. -- Once application reaches the top of the list an appointment will be scheduled.
site_eligibility: Low income

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Peru.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Peru in Miami County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4pm; Wed 8am-noon
Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4pm; Wed 8am-noon
Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4pm; Wed 8am-noon

site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Peru

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Peru.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Peru in Miami County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Peru.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in the city of Peru in Miami County, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and provides dead animal pick-up. Provides lost-and-found services and adopts out homeless dogs and cats. Issues pet registrations in the city of Peru.
site_details: Call or walk in for information; lost-and-found notices and animals available for adoption can also be viewed on Facebook.
site_eligibility: Animal Control and Licensing: Living in the city of Peru -- All Other Services: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Peru.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, snow and ice control, groundskeeping of public properties, and garbage collection services in the city of Peru in Miami County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Peru

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Peru.
service_description: Provides electric, water, sanitary sewer, and storm water utility services for the city of Peru, Grissom Aeroplex, and limited rural areas in Miami County.
site_details: Call for assistance. -- Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Peru, Grissom Aeroplex, and limited rural areas

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and wellness programs, including transportation to residents.
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight-lifting, aerobics, and swimming lessons/water aerobics. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center, fitness classes, and pool and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to join or register for specific programs. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Miami County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Miami County.
service_description: Maintains the Miami County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living within the Oak Hill United Schools district of Grant and Miami County -- Limit one visit every 30 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Solicits individual and corporate donations to fund and support partner agencies and programs that address human service needs in Miami County. All assistance is provided through partnering agencies; no direct services are provided through this agency.
site_details: Human service agencies and individuals wishing to make donations, call or visit website for information. -- Persons seeking assistance or wishing to access services funded by United Way, call 2-1-1
site_eligibility: Human services agencies in Miami County

agency_desc: A government organization that provides a variety of assistance programs for all branches of active-duty service members, veterans, and their families.
service_description: Provides information, referrals, advocacy, and support for all branches of military service personnel, including active-duty reserve and guard, veterans, and their family members. Services include deployment and reunification support, family budgeting and financial counseling, mental health counseling and referrals for ongoing support, employment assistance, and more.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for assistance or to schedule an appointment. -- Walk-ins accepted, but calling ahead is recommended -- Non-service members will need to report to the Visitors Center to get a pass to enter into the base when transporting a member.
site_eligibility: Military service personnel (all branches), veterans, and their families

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization focused on helping people with disabilities and the elderly in Miami County by providing aluminum ramps and adaptive medical equipment to those who cannot afford them, and provides a discount medical equipment and thrift store.
service_description: A nonprofit organization focused on helping people with disabilities and the elderly in Miami County by providing aluminum ramps and adaptive medical equipment to those who cannot afford them, and provides a discount medical equipment and thrift store.  Accepts donations and volunteers.
site_details: Call to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Miami County -- For ramp construction: household income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level with a medical need for an exterior ramp

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Miami County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Miami County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Peru in Miami County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Peru in Miami County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Miami County Central dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Peru in Miami County

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services in the city of Peru in Miami County.
service_description: Provides free smoke detectors to households in need in the city of Peru, when funds are available.
site_details: Walk in to apply; provided name and address.
site_eligibility: Home owners -- Financial need

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for all veteran issues, including providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Send an email, call, or walk in for assistance.
site_eligibility: Living in Miami County -- Veterans and surviving spouses and children of veterans

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Miami County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the appropriate court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Miami County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Miami County Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Miami County, Superior Court 1 handles small claims cases.
site_details: Call or walk in to the county clerk's office.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Miami County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Miami County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: The public library has boosted their WiFi to extend service to parking lots.
site_details: Walk in to building or parking lot to use Wi-Fi.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Those in an urgent situation may call the office to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Bunker Hill -- Financial need (based on assessment) -- Limit one visit every two months

agency_desc: Offers adult education and high school equivalency classes, and provides a test site for the high school equivalency exam.
service_description: Offers instruction in basic language arts, math, reading, science, and social studies as well as preparation for the high school equivalency test. Morning and evening classes available throughout the year .
site_details: Call to make an appointment to register.
site_schedule: Office: Mon and Wed 5pm-8pm; Tues-Thurs 9am-noon -- Classes: Vary
Office: Mon and Wed 5pm-8pm; Tues-Thurs 9am-noon -- Classes: Vary
Office: Mon and Wed 5pm-8pm; Tues-Thurs 9am-noon -- Testing: Vary
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a financial assistance program.
service_description: Provides last resort financial assistance for utilities to Miami County residents in need. Assistance is provided on a case-by-case basis and depends on the availability of funds. Clients must first seek assistance from their Township Trustee, Helping Hands, and Salvation Army.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Already contacted appropriate Township Trustee, Helping Hands, and Salvation Army for this need. -- Not received assistance within the past 12 months

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing clothing and hygiene items for children need in Miami County, Indiana.
service_description: Filling unmet needs of Miami County children in the foster care system is our number one priority,  We also provide clothing, hygiene and baby gear to Miami County individuals, children and families in need. Clothing sizes range from newborn through plus-size adults. Limited service area: Miami County
site_details: Call or email us to schedule an appointment or contact us via our C.C.'s Closet Facebook page; provide the personal information requesting, the clothing size(s) and specific items needed.
site_eligibility: Miami County, Indiana children in the foster care system with clothing or other unmet needs -OR- children, individuals or families in Miami County who are in need of assistance with clothing, toiletry/hygiene items or baby gear.

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry serving Allen and Union Townships of Miami County.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Park in front of the building. Staff will bring food to your vehicle.
site_eligibility: Living in Allen or Union Township in Miami County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office patrols the Indiana East-West Toll Road that runs across northern Indiana.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Cass, Fulton, Grant, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County.

agency_name: VETERANS AFFAIRS NORTHERN INDIANA HEALTH CARE SYSTEM
agency_desc: A veterans' hospital with mental and physical health services, as well as community-based outpatient clinics.
site_name: HOOSIER VA CLINIC - VETERANS AFFAIRS NORTHERN INDIANA HEALTH CARE SYSTEM
service_description: Provides confidential inpatient and outpatient mental health and addiction treatment services for eligible veterans. Services include inpatient detoxification, outpatient substance abuse treatment, dual diagnosis treatment, mental health consultation and therapy, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) treatment, and vocational rehabilitation.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

site_details: New Patients: Call to begin the application process. -- Existing Clients: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Emergency food assistance is available by appointment. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Miami County
